channel.title: Ever wonder how much memory your server is using?
channel.description:
i take no credits for this
ok if you have jdk1.6.0_02 then this will work. open up C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin once inside the bin file look for jconsole [img]http://i94.photobucket.com/albums/l87/zuppers/RuneScape0004-1.jpg[/img]
when you run it you should get this [IMG]http://i94.photobucket.com/albums/l87/zuppers/jconsole.jpg[/img]
next click on local process then pick your rs2 server ***it must be running*** for me mine is called server hit connect [IMG]http://i94.photobucket.com/albums/l87/zuppers/jconsole2.jpg[/img]
as you can see you can look at the overview,memory,threads,classes,VM summary,andMbeans
this program will allow you to clear up space i think on your server using a button called Perform GC the button is in the memory tab. this will also let you know if your server is lagging,crashed,ect without having to log into it or having to look at the MS-DOS Batch File

item.title: Ever wonder how much memory your server is using?
item.dc:creator: @baxi60 baxi60
item.description:
@baxi60 wrote:

10MB if nobody is on. and 50 if above 80 are.

Read full topic
